metadata.title: CVE-2020-12417 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Due to confusion about ValueTags on JavaScript Objects, an object may passthrough the type barrier, resulting in memory corruption and a potentiallyexploitable crash. *Note: this issue only affects Firefox on ARM64platforms.* This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.10, Firefox < 78,and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12417` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
